Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

People who suffer from itchy eyes often use eye drops for symptom relief. An eye doctor plans to conduct a study to investigate the following claim made in an advertisement.

For people who suffer from itchy eyes, Eye Drop V is more effective in providing itch relief than Eye Drop W.

The doctor will randomly assign <math alttext="500" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers with itchy eyes to use one of two eye drops, with <math alttext="250" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> assigned to use Eye Drop V each day and the remaining <math alttext="250" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>250</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> assigned to use Eye Drop W each day. The doctor will record the number of people who experience itch relief after one week for each eye drop.

(a) Describe the benefit of randomly assigning the type of eye drop to the volunteers.

(b) Describe a process that can be used to randomly assign the <math alttext="500" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers to the two eye drops.

The following segmented bar graph shows the results from the study.

(c) For the <math alttext="500" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> volunteers in the study, is there support for the claim made in the advertisement? Justify your answer using values from the segmented bar graph. Do not perform an inferential procedure.

The doctor conducted a hypothesis test to investigate the claim made in the advertisement. Let <math alttext="p sub V" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> be the proportion of people similar to those in the study who would experience itch relief using Eye Drop V, and let <math alttext="p sub W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> be the proportion of people similar to those in the study who would experience itch relief using Eye Drop W. The hypotheses of the test are:

<math alttext="H sub 0: p sub V equals p sub W. H sub a: p sub V is greater than p sub W." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>{</mo><mtable columnalign="left" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

(d) Explain why it is reasonable to conclude that the sampling distribution of <math alttext="p hat sub V minus p hat sub W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>âˆ’</mo><msub><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mtext>W</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is approximately normal.

(e) Based on the hypothesis test and resulting <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of <math alttext="0.003" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.003</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, what can the doctor conclude about the claim made in the advertisement? Explain your answer.
